intro: Carduus salisburgensis, commonly known as the Salzburg thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 60–120 cm, with spiny, lobed leaves and purple to pinkish flowers. It thrives in dry, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
